sanskrit_verse:
अन्धो मत्स्यानिवाश्नाति स नरः कण्टकैः सह ।
यो भाषतेऽर्थवैकल्यमप्रत्यक्षं सभां गतः ॥ ८.९५॥
transliteration:
andho matsyān ivāśnāti sa naraḥ kaṇṭakaiḥ saha |
yo bhāṣate 'rthavaikalyam apratyakṣaṃ sabhāṃ gataḥ || 8.95||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who, though not perceiving the deficiency of meaning, speaks falsely in the assembly—such a man eats fish with thorns, like a blind man.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from clarity of perception, not mere presence in discourse
Causation arises from misalignment between cognition and expression
Capacity-based responsibility requires integrity of sight, speech, and context
Restoration logic demands purification of expressive faculty when distortion occurs
Consciousness alignment necessitates acknowledgment of perceptual limitation before verbal action
executable_legal_axioms: IF speaker enters assembly AND articulates without direct perception THEN assign completion process for sensory-integrity restoration
IF false speech originates from unverified inference THEN initiate responsibility-assumption protocol prior to further participation
IF participant lacks capacity to verify truth THEN exclude from declarative judgment roles UNTIL capacity is restored
IF speech causes disorientation in collective understanding THEN execute reintegration sequence for speaker's expressive field
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any judge or witness who offers testimony or rulings based on indirect knowledge must undergo immediate capacity verification. The threshold of responsibility lies not in intent but in the alignment of cognition with expression. Authority is suspended until such alignment is demonstrably restored through conscious completion processes.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality establishes that erroneous speech stems from defective perception, not malicious will. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that distorted expression follows obscured vision. Proportional responsibility aligns with the degree of awareness at time of utterance. Non-punitive reality rule affirms that correction flows from realignment of consciousness, not infliction of consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate sensory-integrity completion process to restore accurate perception faculties
Assign silence-and-listening period to recalibrate expressive accuracy
Engage in truth-receptivity sadhana under guidance until capacity for verified articulation returns
Undertake group reintegration ritual wherein speaker acknowledges source of error and reaffirms commitment to dharma-vakya
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores balance through consciousness purification, rejects punitive frameworks, and affirms reality as governed solely by the sequential unfoldment of truthful awareness. Dharma is thus established, reality remains non-punitive, and consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
